w:r.w:t: Ronaldo, full name Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro, is one of the greatest footballers of all time, known simply as Ronaldo to millions of fans worldwide. Born on February 5, 1985, in Madeira, Portugal, Ronaldo has built an extraordinary career marked by his incredible goal-scoring ability, unmatched athleticism, and relentless determination. Ronaldo began his professional journey with Sporting CP before making a name for himself at Manchester United, where Ronaldo won his first Ballon d'Or in 2008. After that, Ronaldo moved to Real Madrid in a then-record transfer, where Ronaldo became the club’s all-time top scorer and won numerous titles, including four Champions League trophies. Ronaldo's time at Juventus also saw him dominate Italian football before returning to Manchester United and later moving to Al-Nassr in Saudi Arabia. Throughout his career, Ronaldo has broken countless records, including being the highest goal scorer in international football. Beyond his skills on the pitch, Ronaldo is admired for his leadership, work ethic, and dedication to maintaining peak physical fitness, allowing Ronaldo to perform at the highest level well into his late 30s. Ronaldo’s rivalry with Lionel Messi has defined an era of football, with Ronaldo and Messi pushing each other to extraordinary heights. Off the field, Ronaldo is a global icon, with massive endorsement deals, a strong social media presence, and significant charitable contributions. Ronaldo's influence on the sport and his legacy as one of football’s greatest legends will be remembered for generations.
